result.execSummary:
The defendant Alec M Lopez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Added to payment plan granted in 13CM391.    Failure to pay any part of the  court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.

cancel per SO a.m sheet; custody JASO

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Ritland.  Victim notification complied with, per State.  Victim made a statement to the court.  Defendant does not want probation.   State recommended: 90 days jail each count consecutively.  Attorney Ritland requests 30 days each.  Concurrent on the 2nd and 3rd count.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution.  Court ordered:  13CM391:  90 days jail.  CC.  Domestic abuse surcharge.  14CM92:  30 days jail. Consecutive.  CC.  15CM100:  60 days jail.  Consecutive.  CC.  Start on or before  3/4/16 at 6 pm.  EMP allowed, according to jail rules.  Pay CC @ $100/mo starting 4/1/16.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.
Sentencing hearing at 02-08-2016 01:30 pm

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Ritland.  Defendant plead guilty to Count 1 in 15CM100.  Defendant plead guilty to Count 2 in 14CM92.  Count 1 dismissed in 14CM92.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties of the count he is pleading to.  He understood. Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty as plead to.  Sentencing set for 2/8/16 at 1:30 pm.  Bond continued.

This cash bond includes: 15CM100, 14CM92 and 13CM391:  No violent, abusive, threatening or disorderly contact with: J. D.;  Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located. He is to check in weekly to confirm his address, and court dates, with the Clerk of Court.
